TestCase_BC0460_HuffmanIncompleteSet_0_8 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA, open TUI session
Focus:
Call tlApiTuiSetImage with test image
Test Steps:
The inflate bitstream contains an incomplete code (ie the Huffman binary tree for this code is not full). The inflate stream is compliant with RFC 1951, so the PNG should be considered as valid. It should be decoded as a 16x16 fully green image.

Huffman code for the literal/length alphabet encodes only 3 symbols on 8 bits each: 
                  Symbol |   Code
                  ------ | --------
                       0 | 00000000
                     255 | 00000001
                     256 | 00000010
Note:
libpng, or more precisely zlib, does not support incomplete code sets. It is disabled for security reason, because incomplete code triggered buffer overflows in zlib inflate implementation (CVE-2005-2096). However, RFC 1951 does not mandates the huffman code to be complete, so this image should be considered as valid. No sane encoder should produce an inflate stream with an incomplete code set (and such image are not readable by libpng, hence by virtualy not any PNG reader).
Verification:
Check TA result must be RET_OK
Post Conditions:
Close TUI session, close TA
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
TrustedUI.0400_PNGLibrary.BC0460_HuffmanIncompleteSet_0_8
TestCase_BC0460_HuffmanCompleteSet_8_8 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA, open TUI session
Focus:
Call tlApiTuiSetImage with test image HuffmanCompleteSet_8_8.png
Test Steps:
All symbols on the literal/length alphabet are coded on 8bit. The code is complete (huffman binary tree is full). The image should be decoded as a 16x16 fully green image.

Huffman code for the literal/length alphabet encodes each symbols on its natural binary representation on 8bits, except for 255 and 256 
                  Symbol |   Code (9 bits)
                  ------ | --------
                       0 | 00000000
                       1 | 00000001
                       2 | 00000010
                        ...
                     252 | 11111100
                          (253 and 254 are not encoded)
                     255 | 11111101
                     256 | 11111110

Huffman code for the literal/length alphabet is: 
                  Symbol |   Code
                  ------ | --------
                  0      |  0
                  1      |  10
                  2      |  110
                  3      |  1110
                  4      |  11110
                  5      |  111110
                  6      |  1111110
                  7      |  11111110
                  8      |  111111110
                  9      |  1111111110
                  10     |  11111111110
                  11     |  111111111110
                  12     |  1111111111110
                  13     |  11111111111110
                  255    |  111111111111110
                  256    |  111111111111111

The test image contains an invalid image, because the inflate stream contains an over-subscribed set of length for 3bits codes. The code lengths for the literal/length alphabet is as follows: 
                  1bit  : 255
                  2bits : 0
                  3bits : 1 to 254    (over-subscribed)
                  4bits : 256
Verification:
Check TA result is E_TLAPI_TUI_IMG_BAD_FORMAT.
Post Conditions:
Close TUI session, close TA

TestCase_BC0461_HuffmanInvalidLength18 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA, open TUI session
Focus:
Call tlApiTuiSetImage with HuffmanInvalidLength18.png
Test Steps:
The test image contains an invalid image because, in the inflate stream, the first symbol in code lengths sequence is a repetiton character (symbol=18). The code lengths sequence is as follows 
                  111     # 111 encodes the symbol 18 (repetition character)
                  0111101 # extra 7 bit (94 => repeat "0" 105 times)
                  111     # 111 encodes the symbol 18 (repetition character)
                  0111101 # extra 7 bit (94 => repeat "0" 105 times)
                  111     # 111 encodes the symbol 18 (repetition character)
                  0111101 # extra 7 bit (94 => repeat "0" 105 times)
                  111     # 111 encodes the symbol 18 (repetition character)
                  1111111 # extra 7 bit (94 => repeat "0" 138 times)
Note:
As of this writting, this image triggers a buffer overflow in DrTui. The values for code lenghts have been chosen to overflow as many bytes as possible.
Verification:
Check TA result is E_TLAPI_TUI_IMG_BAD_FORMAT.
Post Conditions:
Close TUI session, close TA
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
TrustedUI.0400_PNGLibrary.BC0461_HuffmanInvalidLength18

TestCase_BC0461_HuffmanOnlyOneSymbol (  )

078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA, open TUI session
Focus:
Call tlApiTuiSetImage with HuffmanOnlyOneSymbol.png
Test Steps:
The test image is valid. It contains 2 DEFLATE streams: The first one is a compressed stream containing only one symbol (End of block, encoded as '0'). Then, the second stream is an uncompressed DEFLATE stream containng the actual pixel data. The purpose of this test is to check that the inflate library is able to decode codes that only encodes one symbol (this is an incomplete code).

TestCase_BC0473_fuzzing_xcsn0g01_807 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA, open TUI session
Focus:
Call tlApiTuiSetImage with fuzzing_xcsn0g01_807.png
Test Steps:
Non regression test for TBUG-56. This PNG was generated by the fuzzing tool radamsa. It declares an image width of 268435488, which makes the computation of the required output buffer size (width × height × 4 byte/pixel) overflow. This makes the image pass test on the size of output buffer, and then create a buffer overflow (see JIRA ticket http://jira.trustonic.internal/jira/browse/TBUG-56 for details). The test PNG is invalid, but there should be no crash of the driver
Verification:
Check TA result is E_TLAPI_INVALID_INPUT

TestCase_BC0496_NonRegressionTBUG465 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
078a0000000000000000000000000000
Pre Conditions:
Open TA Session, open TUI session
Focus:
Test for the presence of TBUG-465 in the product.
Test Steps:
Try to load the PNG file fuzz-10051 in TUI to trigger the the buffer overflow decribed TBUG-465. The PNG is invalid, the CRC of the last chunk has one byte which is after the end of the file. The TUI driver should respond an error to the TA without crashing. Since the buffer overflow is only the drTui reading outside of the buffer, not writting, the overflow is hard to detect. The test TA will put the PNG at the end of a page boundary to ensure that any attempt of the driver to read past the buffer will crash the driver.
Verification:
Verify that the drTui return E_TLAPI_TUI_IMG_BAD_FORMAT without crashing
Post Conditions:
Close TA Session, close TUI session
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
No
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
TrustedUI.0400_PNGLibrary.BC0496_NonRegressionTBUG465
